revised_title: Investigations on the Electric Discharge and Pressure of Minimum Resistance in Partially Exhausted Tubes
tldr: The authors investigate the electric discharge and pressure of minimum resistance in partially exhausted tubes, finding that the pressure of minimum resistance varies with the size and shape of the vessel containing the gas. They conclude that the transfer of electricity requires the presence of ponderable matter, rather than the ether, and discuss the implications for the height and visibility of the aurora borealis.
